Today the scourge of AIDS poses a citywide health-care crisis and is a sharply disputed issue in New York City's mayoral campaign. Page 30.
Little League Title for U.S. The Trumbull, Conn., team won the
Little League World Series, defeating Taiwan, which took the title the three previous years. Sports, section 8.

U.S. Cuts Prison Furloughs The Administration has ordered that many inmates, including major drug offenders, be ineligible for furloughs from Federal prisons. The action results from a campaign promise George Bush made last year. Page 20.
Arafat Considers Visit The United States may again be faced with the issue of whether to allow entry to Yasir Arafat, who may seek to visit the U.N. Page 9.
Push on Global Warming Soviet and American conferees in Utah urged Presidents Bush and Gorbachev to create an ''environmental security alliance.'' Page 28.
A Rise in Racial Hatred Experts say a black youth's killing in Brooklyn last week reflects a rise in racial bias among the young. Page 32.
